cloud_services_and_license_support.notes: Driven by AI data platform, Autonomous Database, and multi-cloud partnerships

remaining_performance_obligations.context: Includes multi-cloud, Oracle Cloud@Customer, and AI contracts

non_gaap.context: Non-GAAP excludes stock-based comp, amortization, other charges

cash_flow.notes: High capex due to OCI capacity expansion

cloud_growth: OCI consumption revenue up 62% and infrastructure revenue up 52%, reflecting insatiable AI demand
MultiCloud database revenue up 115% Q3-to-Q4, with 23 MultiCloud regions live and 47 more planned
Oracle Cloud@Customer deployments up 104%, with 29 live and 30 additional sites scheduled
applications: Strategic SaaS applications achieved $9.3B annualized run rate and 20% growth, backed by 100+ AI agents
Total application subscription revenue grew 7%, demonstrating renewed demand for back-office modernization
ai_and_infrastructure: Oracle AI Data Platform and Database 23AI deliver secure, private AI workloads on OpenAI/Grok/Llama
Autonomous Database and AI-enabled Agents continue to automate operations while tightening security

capex.notes: Plan to keep expanding data center capacity; could exceed $25B

fiscal_year_2026.notes: FY26 will be even stronger, propelled by AI and Oracle’s full-stack cloud advantage

q4_guidance.notes: Guidance assumes currency stays near today’s levels

metadata.source: Q4 FY25 press release + call transcript
